page.title: 01STUDLAND INTRODUCTION
page.content: The Studland area consists of sea, heathland,forestry and buildings.The buildings are mainly Councils houses, private houses,guest houses,shops, etc. Towards North & West of Studland all that can be found is mainly heathland, forestry & sand dunes and the beach, although a Nature Reserve has been added.South of Studland,Ballard Down looms above the area.{Ballard Down}is made of chalk & is used for grazing. Below Ballard Down{Glebeland Estate}is situated.It's mainly an estate for retired people.East of Studland is where the actual village stands plus the pebble beach. In winter Studland becomes a quiet village for all local residents,yet in Summer,Studland becomes a busy holiday resort.
